entry.title: 0.8.1 ideas
entry.summary: The discussion started with Cameron Garnham's opinion that everyone who signed up for Bitcoin assumed there was a 1MB/block limit. He further added that the lock limits were unexpected and should be considered extremely uncontroversial to remove. Another participant in the discussion pointed out that software behavior which is not described by the source code should not be considered an integral part of the rule set. This means that any influence of external libraries on the consensus mechanism is unacceptable.
